Health & Safety for Licensed Child Care Providers: Appropriate Precautions in Transporting Children
Section 4: Keeping Kids Safe In & Around Vehicles

Participation Activity

Match the Safety Risk with the Prevention Strategy

Now we will do a participation activity to serve as a reinforcement of the content in this section of the course. Use the dropdown menus below to select the safety risk that can be avoided if you act in accordance with each of the following prevention strategies.

Note: You will use each option only once.

Remember, in order for this course to be considered "complete," you must participate in all activities throughout this course.

Prevention Strategies

Safety Risks

Display Answers
X
Safety Risk Preventative Strategy
Hypothermia & Hyperthermia Never leave a child alone in a car.
Trunk Entrapment Install a glow in the dark trunk latch.
Carbon Monoxide Poisoning Never warm up a car in an enclosed or partially enclosed garage.
Rollover Accidents Teach children never to walk in front of or behind a vehicle.
Seat Belt Entanglement Buckle up unused seat belts.
Power Window Injuries Make sure child’s hands, feet, & head are clear of windows before raising them.
